comments:
MKTG 754 provides a systematic presentation of the factors to be considered when setting price, and shows how pricing alternatives are developed. Analytical methods are developed and new approaches are explored for solving pricing decisions. The format of the course is predominately lecture and discussion.
	The majority of students truly enjoyed the class, with many students describing it as an “excellent course.” Because there were many real world examples, a few students looked forward to applying the concepts and lessons into a practical setting. One student felt that the course “would be great to have it as a full credit [to] delve deeper and take advantage” of the combination of “stat, finance, strategy, and econ.” A few students felt that the course developed key concepts that would benefit them in the future.
	In general, students felt that Professor Raju was a fantastic instructor with a “great sense of humor” that often took examples from his personal experience.  Professor Raju had an “obvious joy in teaching” and made the class more interesting. 
	The class was directed towards MBA graduate marketing students. The students felt that the workload was light and the material had little conceptual variance. One student felt the lack of a comprehensive text or set of readings to clarify some concepts forced them to look elsewhere for understanding. Prerequisites include: Completion of MKTG 611 or 621; MKTG 612, 613 or 622 concurrently; OPIM 621 and STAT 621 are recommended.
